page.title: 05FARMING IN HENLLAN (1)
page.content: Farming is the main economic activity in the block.Almost all the farms are owner-occupied family farms of medium size (100to200 acres).The farms specialise in livestock rearing with cattle and sheep equally important. Farming is based on the use of grass for fodder as few other crops are grown.The is grazed in the summer and also provides the main bulk of winter fodder in the form of hay and silage. Because of the vagaries of the climate silage is now more important than hay. The farms are highly mechanised and the use of forage harvesters has led to a larger number of bigger tractors being used. Some of the harvesting is carried out by contractors.
